review: I have had my apple TV for just a few days now and I have loved it every minute!  I have been able to watch all the movies that I have on my iTunes account with just a click through airplay.  Im gonna order another one for the bedroom TV!  The remote that comes with the apple tv is kinda lame, but the iphone/ipad has a "remote" app that is perfect and makes finding the movies i want to watch a breeze!
author: David

review: I've been pretty happy with Apple TV so far -- I have it installed with HDMI cable to the TV, and a TOSLINK fiber-optic audio cable to my receiver.  Simple to install, works right out of the box.  I've not had the buffering issues that some reviewers mention, and the router we are using (Linksys 802.11g) is perfectly fine to give me good signal strength.Works well for YouTube, works well for Vimeo, works good with Airplay.  EXCELLENT with NetFlix, also-- the interface is better than on several Blu-Ray players I have seen.Integration with other apple devices is seamless -- you just suddenly have the "send to AppleTV" option on your phone or iPad.If you have other Apple devices, and a decent wireless setup, this will be a good addition to your media devices.
author: J. Spurlin

review: Pros:If you have an Apple products like iPad, iPhone you can play or mirror content from your ipad and iphone on your LCD/LED TV .It also plays content from your iTunes on your PC/Mac.It also has optical output that you can connect to your old receiver to have 5.1 audio from Netflix.Cons:When compared to Roku 2 it has very less content. Roku 2 has way more channels to offer that Apple TV.
